tagDescription: to Lord Selkirk. Re Two acts passed last session by P.E.I. Legislative Assembly affecting His Lordship's interests in the Colony & enclosing two newspapers containing same.
to Lord Selkirk, Giving sketch of the proceedings of the N. W. Co for the destruction of the R.R.Colony.
Scroll copy letter to Earl of Hardwiches seeking advice re- settlement of boundaries of R.R.S.,and N.W.Co encroachments.
Copy. Surrender of Grand River lands by Mohawk Indians to Wm.Dickson.
to Lord Selkirk, Soliciting employment in the service of the H.B.Co.
Copy of Lord Selkirk's terms for American Settlers, given to Mr.Roderick McDonald.
to Lord Selkirk, Re Supply for himself and his miner-and advance of Â£200. Passengers in good health and spirits.
Scroll copy to Robt.Dickson, Re Letters to be given to Mr.Nolin to carry to York. All -re- his (Dickson's) conversation with Dowsman re-cattle for R.R.S.
to Lord Selkirkm Re The Settlers & Clerks for the R.River Expedition. The connection of Mr.Johnston of St.Mary with the N.W.Co. Peace with the U.S. & their interests in the H.B.Co. trade.
Scroll copy letter to Robt.Dickson. Re Boundary lines between Canada and the United-States also-re- the settling of himself at Grand Frenche.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The ill-treatment he has received at the hands of the N.W.Co in connection with the work of the South West side of Lake Superior.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The purchase of his(S's) property by the Government of P.E.I. NULL.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The purchase of his (S's) property by the Government of P.E.I.
to Lord Selkirk, Detailing the unfortunate circumstances in connection with the establishing of Red River Colony.1st letter. Molestation of the N.W.Co. the chief feature.
Alex. MacDonell's Memo re- Settlers at Baldoon and lands to be located.
to Lord Selkirk, Re His(S's) property in P.E.I. and the projected Canal into the Bay of Fundy.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to James Sutherland.Committee gratified with his conduct and merits during tedious passage to Canada.

to Mile McDonell. Re The affairs at Red River Settlement.-------assistance to soldiers,division of the Indian lands,Prohibition of the export of provisions, the coming of the Sutherland Settlers,Method of obtaining and preserving Buffaloe meat for winter use,Sewing of seed,Articles to be sent out by ship,Mistake in accounts,preservation of gunpowder against dampness.Works at Pembina & removal of people therefrom.Plan for winter despatch route from England to the Colony. Cultivation & progress at Hill River and posts below Lake Winipic and orders for accounts to be sent in duplicate-(this is a duplicate of letter on P.1492.
to Lord Selkirk, (Copy) Informing him that Ld.S. has received a better offer than his for the property. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk, 13 Apl. 1860.
Instructions of Lord Selkirk to Wm.Burn-re- American Emigration.
Scroll copy letter to Captain Matthey-re- interview with Mrs.McL about their land.No arrangements made Protestant clergyman to be sent for the Settlement; also-re- boundary lines of Settlers' lots.
Scroll copy  letter to Alex.McDonell of R.R. Re Arrangements for arrival of Captain Matthey who takesover all that relates to defence & protection of R.R.S.
Memo and letter addressed to the Earl of Liverpool,apparently by Lord Selkirk re- his grant in U.C.
Lord Selkirk's Diary No IV from 21 Feby-4 June 1 1804. Subjects of which are in Margin.

to Lord Selkirk, Enquiring as to what he will do with Bills rec'd from Mr. Grayn of Boston. Encloses copy of a letter he wrote to Lord Stanley and also copies of correspondence with T.C.S.Corry re- purchase of a lot of his Ld. S's land in P.E.I. Requests information as to procedure with the affairs of the Estate.
"PRIVATE." E.Colville to Wm.Douse, Re E.Colville. Survey & purchase of Selkirk's property in P.E.I. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk. 15Aug. 1860.
Scroll copy letter to Wm.Laidlau, Re Men required for R.R.S.;cattle and Pigs, etc. Enclosing memo.-re- the Hayfield farm on Red River.
Copy of Lord Selkirk's obligation and terns under which each single man settler is to be bound. One year free and 100 acres land.
Scroll copy letter to Captain Matthey. Re Several warrants & petition of Settlers of R.R.S. to British Parliament.
Instructions to Wm Burn re-people for Selkirk Settlement.

Scroll copy letter-Lord Selkirk to Capt.Matthey, Acknowledging receipt of his letter of the 13th receipt of his letter of the 13th Sep last; and -re- the Pretentions of Chief Justice Powell as to the Boundaries of Canada.
to Govr,Geo.Dundas, Informing him of Power of Atty & Instructions given to Mr.Wm.Douse for sale of Selkirk property in P.E.I. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk 15 Aug. 1860.)
to Lord Selkirk, Re The remedy of the mischief done by Lt-Govr.Fitaroy in P.E.I. and the projected Land Co. of the Island.
Scroll copy of letter to Wm.Laidlaw. Re A ploughman that  is wanted at R.R. Also re-Settlers
List of Bargains made regarding the Settlers for America.
to Lord Selkirk. Enclosing letter for Colville re Selkirk Property in P.E.I. also list of proprietors and their agents and list of Governor & Council Members of Legislative Assembly.
Scroll copy letter to Rev.J.N.Provencher,-re- The supply of articles that will be forwarded for his Establishment at R.R.S.
to Lord Selkirk;thanks for letter from his brother brought by Lord Selkirk.Offers his services.

Re Address of A.McLean & twelve other Settlers to Lord Selkirk,presented by John Pritchard----to the plundering and burning of the R.R.Settlement by the N.W.Co and the insufficient protection provided for safety against these attacks.
to Lord Selkirk, Has done as requested with Bills of exchange. Encloses Memo of his transactions.

Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell-re- the Articles being shipped to R.R.S. by the ship Prince of Wales. Instructions as to distribution of same also granting of lots and furnishing of deeds of conveyance to Settlers; the subject of distillation at R.R. The H.B.Co Rights;new Settlers that will sail for R.R. during the year,& employment of same;allowance to Mr. Cuddie as Surgeon to the Settlement;suggests return of men under Mr.Laidlaw's charge,to the H.B.Co or transfer of them to any of the Superior Settlers who may want servants.Encloses letters for Capt.Matthey,Mr.Dickson & Mr.Laidlaw. Authorizes that Matthey's letter be opened by person in charge in the event of his having been arrested by the N.W.Co.
Scroll copy letter to James Bird. Re Improvement of communication between York Factory & Lake Winnipeg.
Scroll copy letter ,Lord Selkirk to Js.Johnston, re- Johnston's sacrifice made for the R.River people.
to Lord Selkirk. Enclosing copies of letters from Wm.Douse and Govr. Dundas and re- H.B. Affairs.
Scroll copy letter Lord Selkirk to Rev.Dr.Plunkett Catholic Bishop at Elphin,re- the selection of a Priest for Ossiniboia.
to Lord Selkirk, Annexing copy of letter from Govr,Dundas,re- Douse's statement of Lord Selkirk's property?

to E.Colville, Enclosing Statement of Messrs Douse and Aldom re- extent of Lord Selkirk's property in P.E.I.-& Purchase of same by Government. (Enclosing in foregoing of Colville to Selkirk, 6 Sept.1860.)
Scroll copy letter to Jas.Bird. Re Enclosing copy of letter addressed to Govr.Vincent with some observations on general management of Affairs at R.R.S.
Instructions to Captiain Cunningham of Steamer "Bess" to be carried out before sailing for New York.
Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell,-re- Mr.Logan who goes to relieve him at R.R.S.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The conditions & affairs at the Settlement and giving some suggestions.
Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell Enclosing letter shewn to Captain Matthey re- arrangements made for conducting business at the Settlement and -re- Law proceedings at Montreal.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to T.Vincent,re- a packet which he entrusts to his care for delivery to Govr. Semple.Wishes to see him at Outlet of Lake Superioe.Encloses letter for Mr.White.
to E.Colville, Re Survey of Lord Selkirk's property by Mr. Douse & purchase of same by Govt. Mony will be paid upon receipt of Deed. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk, 8Aug, 1860.
to Lord Selkirk, Annexing copy of a note from Govr.Geo.Dundas re- survey & purchase of Selkirk property in P.E.I.
Scrool copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Miles McDonell, condemning his concealment of many circumstances in Red River Settlement & disapproving of compromise with Mr.Auld.
Scroll copy letter,Ld.Selkirk to Corporal Matheson granting free passage for himself and arranging that of the rest of his family. Encloses Memo to be shown to Mr Sage and Emigrants.
to Lord Selkirk, Observations re the Colony from the departure of the Settlers from Y.F. on the 6th & 7th Sept. to present date. (Duplicate of Vol. 70,page 18601.)

to Lord Selkirk, Re The prosperity of the Red River Colony.The purchase of land from Sauteaux Indians,to be cultivated and improved for the use of the Colony. Establishment of a school & a Roman Catholic Church. Necessity of a trade communication with Hudson Bay and the Company.

Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Miles McDonellp re- Alex.McDonell who is to remain at R.R.S. before returning for his family.Mr.Rogers who goes alsot to encourage Emigration.The wind Mill,garden & fiel seeds, and portable soup for which Buffaloe meat may be used and re lands to Mr.Cook,a possible settler.
Scroll copy letter to James Bird. Re Articles for the Northern expedition allowed by Committee.
A.MacDonald's List of Settlers at Baldoon.Heads of families and their sons and daughters.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to John McLeod,Y.F Authorizing him to remain at R.River as H.B.Co Emplyee.

to Lord Selkirk, Re Irish Emigrants in U.S.A. Will proceed to America bout middle of April,unless otherwise detained. Memo added by Lord Selkirk -re- allowance to MacDonell during term of Service in U.S.A.

to Lord Selkirk, Re State of his health;the settlement of the Williams' accounts,in connection with His Lordship's Estate;sale of farm Lot 31,abandoned by one Cameron;Conditions at the Cardigan River Settlement, Lot 53; enquiries re Lot 10; Power of Atty to Mr.Wright from Mr.McMillan; The sending of a Schooner loaded with produce,to market in payment of Settlers' debts;and the progress of saw mills The search for and handling of Black Birch timber for ship-building. Wishes to know time set for His Lordship's sailing and wether or not Lady S. accompanies. His letter by Birnies Vessel that was lost,contained the political state of the Island.
Copy-Memorandum of Lord Selkirk's American Emigration terms.-Given Major McDonell.

Scroll copy letter to Miss Edgeworth acknowledging receipt of her letter of Aug.18 and expressing sympathy in their recent family bereavement.No obligation(objection) to letter referred to being published.
to Lord Selkirk.--Has enquired of Dr.Plunkett re- the selection of a priest and has had favorable reply.

Petition of Hugh Gillis to Lord Selkirk-praying for redress of grievances arising out of his agreement with William Douse re- purchase of Land. Encloses copy of agreement.Permission of Douse,& particulars.

to Lord Selkirk, Forwarding List,with remarks, of passengers of the Str. "Hadlow" who are at the Fort.Hopes exertions in securing menfor R.R.S will meet approval.Hopes to bring home favorable account of Colony,and Minerals in Country, ensuing year.
to John McDonell, Re His residence at Red River.The fear of attack from the Indians and the N.W.Co.

to Lord Selkirk. Re The management of affairs at R.R.S. by Captain Matthey.Importance of impressing the people with scheme of Colonization,& relating to occurences of his expedition to Missouris for horses & furs.
to Wm.Douse, Giving power of Atty from Lord Selkirk to carry out agreement of sale of his property in P.E.I. to Government. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk 15 Aug. 1850.)
Copy of terms for Indented men under which they are bound as settlers on Ld.Selkirk's land in America, 3 years wages.Also agreement of Settler.
Scroll Copy letter to Thos.Thomas. Re the coming of priests to R.R. and their welcome.
and Council for R.R.S. to Lord Selkirk.--Stating reasons for leaving Settlement.
to Thomas Clark re-,Baldoon,James Stewart and Archibald McDonell,and invasion of the Americans.
to Lord Selkirk, Reporting re conditions among Settlers on His Lordship' property, good and bad.
Lord Selkirk's Diary No V from Sept. 30th 1804 to Nov.20 1805.
1841. Extract Enclosed in foregoing note of Joseph Hensley -re- payments made by Hugh Gillis on his land in P.E.I.

to Lord Selkirk, Re The disbursements charged to his private account and rightfully belonging to that of Maitland House. Courage and value of Mr. Clarke to the H.B.Co. and the security of the Colonists at Red River.
Extract of a letter from Sir.D.Daly re Lord Selkirk's Lands in P.E.I. and purchase of same by Government.- (Enclosed in E.Colville to Ld. Selkirk, following, of the 28th Aug. 1856.)
Scroll copy of letter to Alex.McDonell. H.B.Co Affairs & R.R. Settlers.

to Lord Selkirk, Leaves to undertake the re- extablishment of the R. R. Colony.Brings to notice several of the deserving settlers,forwards Mr. Pritchard's Journal. Has written the Editor of the Montreal Herald to have the letter written by a "Friend to Colonization", Published in England; and refers to the Athabasca Expedition.

Scroll copy letter Lord Selkirk to Emr.Holte. Disappointed at not receiving letter from Y.F.Will take charge of all letters for Norway.Grants him 300 acres of best land. Is pleased at prospect of his becoming a settler.
Scroll Copy letter of Robert Dickson Re H.B.Co Affairs in America.

Copy of letter, apparently from A.Colville to Lord Stanley(Copy sent to Lord Melville, re the Estate of Lord Selkirk in P.E.I. & submitting observations for his consideration re-Land Tax. -Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk following.)
Kist of Alex.McLean's crops taken before the abandonong of the Settlement by men chosen for that purpose. The original keptin Mr. McLean's possession.(Enclosed in foregoing of McLean to Ld.Selkirk.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Thomas Clark in connection with Baldoon Settlement.
Lord Selkirk's Diary No. III from Nov. 15 1803 to Feby 1804. Subjects in Margins.

to Lord Selkirk, Relating the destruction of the R.R.Colony by the N.W. Co. after the surrender of Miles McDonell to that Company.Requests Court of Justice to be established for the redress of said Company.
to Angus McAuley,John Cameron and James McDonald,Scramable, giving terms offered to Settlers willing to go to U.C.
to Lord Selkirk, Has informed Mr.Douse Jr. that his offer re-purchasing of Selkirk Property has been accepted.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The surrender of himself to the N.W.Co. Recommends his son Aeneas to His Lordship's notice.

Certificate of Benj.Davies,J.P.,and others -re- The Memorial of Hugh Gillis for redress of certain grievances arising out of his agreement with Douse -re- purchase of lot 57.Rnclosed in Petition of Gillis to Lord Selkirk.
to Lord Selkirk, Enclosing extract of Sir.D.Daly's letter re his(S's) property in P.E.I., also form for reply to same, to Mr. Swabey, his Agent for P.E.I.
Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell. Recommending Mr.Nolin Senr. as a probable & valuable settler for R.R.

to Lord Selkirk, Re The destruction of the Colony by the N.W.Co.& Documents which Mr.Archd. McDonald carries home to that effect. The Surrender of Miles McConell to the N.W.Co. The incapability of Mr.White to command, the establishment of the new Colonists; the future colonization of Red River. Mr.Colin Robertson who was requested to take charge by Mr. Thomas,Mr. Rogers who had charge of the new Colonists from Stromness. Mr.Howes  who goes home in the "Prince" & Mr. Stainsby,Surgeon of the "Prince". Opinion as to Captain Turner of the H. B. Service; James Swain appointed Storekeeper at the Settlement. Large quantity of Beer Meal that will not keep,and a few pigs that would be a valuable acquisition to the Colony and that could subsist on the meal.

Maitland, Garden & Auldjo, Enclosing copy of their letter to the Secretary of the Commander of the Forces applying for Military protection to the Red River Colony.- Are sending garden seeds & winter wheat for Captain McDonell per a canoe.Rest of tobacco to be sent following spring;when it will be received from the U.S..Will convey sentiments when something is known in regard to their application to the Governor.

to Lord Selkirk, Re The taking of the tobacco to Jack River. Imprisonment of two of the Colonists by the N.W.Co.in consequence of Miles McDonell's attack on their fort the preceeding summer. Notifies of death of Donald McTavish, Alex. Henry & John Wells; also miscellaneous other things concerning the Colony.
Extract of Sketch of the conduct of the N. W. Co. by Miles McDonell.

Scroll copy letter to Captain Matthey,-re- The attempts that the N.W.Co have in view to arrest him; also-re- validity of the U.C. Warrants in H.B.Territories. Settlers who are to be brought to Red River during coming year.
to Lord Selkirk, Reporting upon the state of the Settlement since his last letter of 12th September 1818.
to Lord Selkirk. Reporting upon his tour round the different departments of Pembina.
to Lord Selkirk, (Enclosing copy of letter received from Warburton repayment of Debentures of Sale of P.E.I. property & Memo of Draft on Union Bank of London.-
Copy.Jas.Warburton to E.Colville-re- payment of Debentures(Enclosing in foregoing of Colville to Selkirk 18 Oct 1870.
to Lord Selkirk, (Enclosing copy of letter received from Warburton repayment of Debentures of sale of P.E.I.property.& Memo of draft on Union Bank of London.)
to E.Colville, Re Payment of debentures(enclosing in foregoing of Colville to Selkirk, 18Oct 1870.
Scroll Copy letter to Jas.Bird, Re The Athabasca expedition.
Memo.-re- Hayfield farm to Wm.Laidlaw, Re Memo.-re-Hayfield at R.R. Enclosed in foregoing to Wm.Laidlaw of Nov. 9 1818.
Scroll Copy letter to Jas.Bird Re Detention of the ship Britannia, and H.B.Co Affairs:
Opinions of the Proprietors and Agents of the P.E.I.re Road Compensation Bill.
Memorandum by R.Jones,of observations-re- the road through the woods from Baldoon to Chatham on River Thames.Estimates of causeways.
Scroll Copy letter to Thos.Vincent. Re Affairs of Moose Factory.
Scroll copy letter to Senior Officer.York Factory, R.R.S. -re- Distribution of Provisions & cattle for the Settlement.
to Andrew Colville. Asking for terms on which Ld. Selkirk will let him purchase a lot in P.E.I. to settle upon. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk, Nov. 22, 1842 following.)
tagPlace: Lough Bawn Shircock, Carrickma Cross. Ireland

tagDescription: Letter(apparently that of Thos. Thomas to Colin Robertson) re duties confered upon himself.Enclosed in foregoing of Colin Robertson to Ld.Selkirk.

Scroll copy letter Lord Selkirk to Miles McDonell-re- Presbyterian clergyman for Kildonan.James Sutherland to act as cathechist, to be instructed by the Minister of his Parish as to solemnization of Mariages among settlers of his congregation.
to A.Colville, Giving information required re- payments in event of a purchase from Ld.Selkirk.(Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk 22 Nov. 1842 following.)
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Robert Semple,-Stornoway men.Emegrants from Skye,and Clarks & inspection men of the H.B.Co.
Scroll Copy letter to Robert Dickason, Re License for his son(?) and miscellaneous matters in connection with R.R.S.
Scroll copy letter to Robert Dickson. Re His expedition to R.R.S.
to Lord Selkirk, Re Payment of Debentures in connection with sale of his property to Govt. Encloses rough form of letter to Mr Warburton re same.
to Lord Selkirk, Re Payment of debentures in connection with sale of his property to Govt. Encloses rough form of letter to Mr.Warburton re same.
Solicitor,enclosing Memorial & Petition of Hugh Gillis.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The news received by the arrival of the Athabasca Express of the renewal of the trouble with the N.W.Co. there.
to E.Colville, Re Survey of Ld.Selkirk's property. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk 15 Aug. 1860
to Lord Selkirk, Enclosing copy of correspondence with Douse & Govr.Dundas re- purchase of P.E.I. property by Govt.
Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell. Re Regulations for the persons appointed to R.R.S. as his successor.
Letter apparently written by instructions of Lord Selkirk to Miles McDonell-re- the errors in submitted accounts of R.R.Settlement.
to Lord Selkirk, Re Some of the intended Settlers for Red River from Kildonan, Ireland.

to Lord Selkirk, Re The conditions at R.R.S. Requests articles of Clothing for his family,amd that a Stile & Caldron be sent out for a distillery. Also that he may be continued as Captain of the Ossiniboia Royal Militia at the Colony. Encloses list of his crops.
to ?.... Enclosing extract furnished by Wm.Douse of payment made by Gillis upon his property.
Scroll Copy letter to Alex.McDonell. Re R.R.S. Affairs.
to Lord Selkirk re- the provision made for a Roman Catholic clergyman of Ossiniboia.
to Lord Selkirk, Re His sister who is determined to sail with him for Hudson Bay and the Colonists on board the "Hadlow" ready for sailing for R.R.Colony.

Scroll copy letter to Robert Dickson,-re- R.R.Lands that fall within the American Boundary lines as fixed by late treaty. Also-re- his(Dickson's) passport to Washington and his settling at Grande Frenche.
List of Proprietors and Agents for them in Prince Edward Island.
Memorandum of Alex.McDonell,re- Instructions as to passage to and in America.
to Ld.Selkirk. Re The trial of Lower Canada prisoners in the U.C. Courts.
to Lord Selkirk. Enclosing Memo of bargain with Government of Price Edward Island -re- His Lordship's property.
Scroll copy letter to Capt.Frk.Matthey, Re. The affairs of the R.R.S.
Sketch of Thomas Clark's farm at Baldoon Settlement.
to Lord Selkirk. Declining a position of Second in Command at the Colony and giving it to Mr.Colin Robertson.
Memo. Instructions for Mr. William and Dr.McAulay to be fulfilled upon their arrival at P.E.I.

Scroll copy letter Lord Selkirk to Alex.McDonell. No Further instructions than those given at Edinburgh. Refers him to John McDonald. Semple will have instructions as to procedure after sailing from Britain. Importance of selecting families as settlers with as many affective men as possible.
John Brown's account in connection with Baldoon Settlement in U.C.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The invasion of the Americans at St.Mary's and Michilimackinac and the affairs at Lake Erie & Huron.
to Andrew Colville, Re The Selkirk Estate in P.E.I. making an offer for same. (Enclosed in Rankin to Selkirk, following.)
Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell, Re Scroll copy letter -re-warrants issued for culprits against who Bill of Indictment have been found in Court of Oyer & Terminer
to Lord Selkirk,re- the selection of a priest for Ossiniboia and enquiring for Rev. Father Burke.
Lord Selkirk's Account with Peter McKee for work done at Settlements.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The securing of young men for the Whale fishery in Davis Straits.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The alterations made in a contract with Mr.James Rogers.
to Colin Robertson, Re The union of the H. B. Co. with the Selkirk Colony, and the preparation for driving the N. W. Co out of the Country.

to Lord Selkirk, Re The capture of Cameron & his men at the N. W. Co. fort at R.R.Forks. Their release on promise of better conduct and agreement to several conditions. Has just received news of the arrival from Jack River of 80 Settlers per the Co'ys ships.
Scroll copy of letter to Capt. F.Matthey, Advises leaving Mr. (Graff)?... In position he now helds.
Account of Lord Selkirk with Andrew Templeton.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Rev.Dr.Murray, Priest at Maynorth Ireland,re- queries-re- selection of a priest for Ossiniboia.
Scroll copy Letter Ld.S.To Dr.Murray,re- Catholic Priest for Ossiniboia Settlement and the enquiry re- Priest Bourke.
to Lord Selkirk. Has agreed to sign with the N.W.Co.

to Lord Selkirk. Encloses extract of letter from Govr.Geo.Dundas enclosing Draft of the Union Bank of England(London) and re-Douse Statement of Ld.S.'s property in P.E.I. & purchase of same by Government.
Scroll copy letter to F. Vincent, Re The H.B. Co. servants to be sent to winter at R.R.S. and the opening of winter communication between the Sault & New-Brunswick.
to Lord Selkirk, Offer of Govr. Geo.Dundas for the P.E.I.property.
Queries of Lord Selkirk re- Irish Catholic Emigrants in America.
to E.Colville. Enclosing second exchange of Bill for Â£1000 Stg.and arranging for the forwarding of debentures of sales of Selkirk property.(Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk 17 Oct. 1860.)
to Sir Geo. Prevest, Applying for a License to import from the U.S.,11,000 lbs Tobacco,on behalf of the H.B.Co & for the use of the settlers.
Scroll copy letter to James Bird. Re. J.B.Nolin who intends to settle at R.R.

(Duplicate) to Andrew Colville, Re Mr.Archibald's claim for Agency. Recommends system of leasing as prejudiciable to selling Ld.Selkirk's property in P.E.I. Is in treaty with several New-Brunswick French re-sale of Lot 10, P.E.I.
Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell. Re Grant of land to Robt.Dickson at R.R.S.
to Lord Selkirk, Re Trouble at the Custom House over the Settlers' parcels.Suggests removal of said House from Kirkwell to Stromness.
Scroll Copy letter to Dond.McLherson. Re Supply of Provisions for R.R.S.
to Robert Semple, Requesting pleasure of his company in a drive to Gravesend.If not convenient,requests to be informed wether or not he procured Books wanted.
to Lord Selkirk, Enclosing copy of letter to Govr.Geo.Dundas accepting his offer for purchase of P.E.I. property.
to Lord Selkirk- Advising him not to answer Hensley's letter but allow Gillis & Douse to settle the matter between themselves.
Petition of Alex. McDonell to H.E.Sir Francis Gore Lt-Govr. of U.C. re- the appropriation of the Townships of Dover & Chatham for Lord Selkirk and a modification of Lord Hobarts' terms.
to Lord Selkirk, Re2 The plan for the Settlement of Ossiniboia.
Scroll copy letter to Mr.J.B.Nolin, Re The establishing of himself & family at R.R.S.

to Lord Selkirk, Re The appointment of Samuel Gale as Barrister for the H.B.Co. Calls attention to Letters printed in English papers & written by Henery against the Red River Settlement. Also the prevention of the N.W.Co ships being sent in the Bay.
to Lord Selkirk, Has taken the liberty to send by Mr. McDonald 12 Buffaloe tongues. Is glad that his conduct throughout the last year has met with approval.

to T.C.S.Corry. Enclosing for his information a statement of the Townships held by Lord Selkirk, showing quantity of land on each, the mode of granting leases, etc. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk, 22 Nov. 1842.)
Certificate of Jos.Ball,Land Surveyor,-re- his survey of Lot 57 being that part of Selkirk Estate sold to Hugh Gillis.Enclosed in petition of Gillis.
Scroll copy letter to James Bird, Re Men for R.R.S. The Athabasca expedition.Loss of Mr.(Robertson)?... letters, etc.
to Lord Selkrik, Conditions at the Settlement better.Cameron of the N.W. Co. taken.No fear from any further attacks of that Company.
Memo.- re- Survey of Dover andChatham in Upper Canada.

to Lord Selkirk, Re The conditions at the Settlement;the unwillingness of the men to defend it against the N.W.Co, when it could easily have been done,and the surrender of Captain Miles McDonell to that Co.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Miles McDonell, re-Deed of Feoffment of the Ossiniboia grant Map-of same.Salt manufacture and curing of fish.
Copy of instructions to W.Hindley-re- Securing of sheep for the Settlement in America.
Scroll copy letter to Alex.McDonell, Re His departure from R.R.S. and the appointment of a successor.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Robert Livingstone requesting that he accompny Mr.McDonell to Drummonds Island to effect the arrest of G.Campbell for whom a warrant has been issued.
to Lord Selkirk. Enclosing copies of his letters to Govr.Dundas & Mr Wm.Douse -re-purchase of P.E.I. property.

Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Govr.Semple,re- the designs of the N.W.Co. on the Selkirk Settlement. Has applied for military protection.Instructions-re- sowing of grain and the use of an old sledge for drawing heavy provisions.Proposition have been made him re- some possible arrangements(agreements between N.W. & H.B.Co.
to Lord Selkirk, Enclosing copy of his letter to Colville re the offer fro Selkirk property in Prince Edward Island.
to --?-- (apparently to Colin Robertson) requesting and pointing out the necessity of his (Robertson's) return to the Settlement.Enclosed in foregoing letter of Colin Robertson to Lord Selkirk.
Scroll copy letter to Bishop Provencher R.R.S.-re- Carpenters and others for R.R.S. Also mail to be carried by Mr.McKenzie who leaves 10 May for Red River.

to T.C.S.Corry. In answer to his enquiries re terms of purchase of a lot on Selkirk property in P.E.I. Request tom be in formed as to payments he could arrange for.(Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk, 22 Nov, 1842 following.)
to Lord Selkirk, Requesting that an appointment be made in his place as he is desirous of leaving the Settlement.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Thomas Thomas, proposing appointment for him at R.R.S.
Scroll copy letter to Capt.F.Matthey, Re The fall Assizez at (Montreal)?... H.B.Co & N.W.Co.

(Copy) (private) E.Colville to Govr.Geo.Dundas Re Sale of Selkirk P.E.I. property to Government. Encloses statement of the land belonging to Ld.S.(Enclosed in foregoing of Colville to Lord Selkirk, 13 Apl. 1860.)
Copy of terms offered by Lord Selkirk to Emigrants from Sky.
Scroll Copy letter to Thos.Vincent. Re Scroll copy letter to Thos Vincent  -re-re-H.B.Co Affairs.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to James White,M.D re- the state of Miles McDonell's health and conduct.To be ready to render medical assistance.
Scroll copy letter Lord Selkirk to Rev.Dr.Murray of the Maynorth Ireland,re- the selection of a Roman Catholic Priest for Ossiniboia Settlement in America.
Instructions to J.Mitchell-re- Sheep for American Settlements.
Memo. For Jas.Woods-re- canoe for R.R. & Cattle, etc
Scroll Copy letter to Alex.McDonell. Re Scroll Copy letter enclosing copy of letter of March 7th and -re- trials in Courts of Justice
Table showing the quantity of land received re-garanted,appropriated by and due to the Earl of Selkirk under Royal order of 28 July 1803 at Baldoon Settlement
to Lord Selkirk, Re Certain sums of mony advanced to Mr.Alex.McDonell by Messrs. McTavish,Fraser & Co in 1812. Requests that he mention his brother's application to the Duke of Bucclengh.
Endorsement of Letter from Governor George Dundas, 1859 re Prince Edward Island. 1831-1842-1856-1859-1860. When the property was sold to Govr. For the Island? (Letter missing.)
Scroll copy letter to Robt.Dickson. Re Warrants issued & obtained for criminals.
Scroll copy letter to RODickson. Enclosing warrants for culprits mentioned in foregoing letter.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Miles McDonell-answering Queries of Mr.Bird of February 1814 re-R.R.S. and Settlers.

to Chas.O.Ermatinger. Re The outrage at Michilipicoton and requesting that the Indian who was carrying the letters be found and his oath taken so that warrant can be issued for arrest of the offender Mackintosh.
Scroll copy letter to Colin Robertson, Re His absence,and assuring him that no inconvenience to his business in England,will result.

Scroll copy letter to Alex. McDonell. Account in his letter of the 13th -re- R.R.S. very satisfactory.Will send a Presbyterian Clergyman out by way of H.Bay ,and suggests means of his support by the Settlers.
to Lord Selkirk,-re- Settlement of Gillis' Affair of lot 57,P.E.I.
to Lord Selkirk, Closing up sale of Selkirk Property in P.E.I. to Government.
to Lord Selkirk, Closing up sale of Selkirk property in P.E.I to Government.
Scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Miles McDonell, re- appointment of Robert Semple as Lt-Govr. of the H.B.Co in Canada,abd that of Thomas Thomas at R.R.S.
to Lord Selkirk, Reports on voyage & the passengers who have just landed bynthe Str. "Hadlow" from Stromness Ireland. Is to be second in command at the Settlement.

to E.Colville. Has been informed by Governor Dundas that debentures re-sale of property will be sent by mail.Deed lodged on Bank for safety.Land affairs in bad confusion at the Island.Commissioners sitting.(Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk 17 Oct, 1860.
Scroll copy letter,Lord S. to Master at Brandon House,-re- the sowing of grain.
Scroll copy letter to Colin Robertson-re- his journey to the Interior & the expedition to Athabasca.
Scroll copy letter to Wm.Laidlaw-re- servants, ploughmen,etc for R.R.S.
to Lord Selkirk, Re The settlement of James Rogers' contract.
Scroll copy letter to Colin Robertson, Dissuading his going to Europe by other way than H.Bay.
to Lord Selkirk, Re His interview with Mr. Douse Jr. and the propositions he makes for the purchase of the Selkirk Property in P.E.I. Encloses memo. of same.
Copy of Lord Selkirk's Instructions to D.MacDonell re- Irish Emigrants in U.S.A.
Scroll copy letter to Jas.Bird. Re The Athabasca expedition and trials in Courts of Justice at Montreal.
Field notes by Adrian Marlet,Provincial Deputy Surveyor,of a tract of Grand River lands near the mouth,belonging to Lord Selkirk.-Enclosing two plans of Lands in Question.
to E. Colville. Acknowledging receipt of letter giving him Power of Atty for the Sale of Selkirk porperty in P.E.I.(Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk 17 Oct,1860.)

to Lord Selkirk. Re. His visit to York Factory which was undertaken at Mr.McDonell's particular request,and reporting on condition of crops and the number of cattle at Hayfield farm.Wishes written instructions -re- the management of same.
Scroll copy letter to Jas.Bird. Re Trade with the Sioux Indians.
(Rough copy) Letter, Lord Selkirk to Mr.Warburton, repayment of debentures to Mr.Eden Colville. (Enclosed in foregoing of Colville to Selkirk, 5 Sept 1870.)
(Rough copy.) Letter. Lord Selkirk to Mr.Warburton -re- payment of debentures to Mr.Eden Colville. (Enclosed in foregoing of Colville to Selkirk 5 Sept.1870.)
to Lord Selkirk, Re Arrangements as to his salary as agent of the H.B.Co.
to Lord Selkirk, Continues in his narrative of the unfortunate circumstances in the Establishment of Red River Colony.
Memo and scroll copy letter,Lord Selkirk to Lt-Gov Robert Semple, re- Captain Turner of H.B.Co. and the impressions he has left with the officers.
to Govr.Geo.Dundas Informing him of the acceptance of his offer of purchase by Lord Selkirk. (Enclosed in Colville to Selkirk, following).
(Duplicate) to Andrew Colville. Enclosing estimate of the value of Lord Selkirk's Estate in P.E.I. with a few remarks on Emigration.
Queries relative to Emigration in Ireland. Transmitted by F.Fitzsimons.
to Lord Selkirk. Re The closing of the purchase of Selkirk property with Govr.Geo.Dundas and Mr.Douse.
